page.title: 07DECLINE OF SMALL FARMS
page.content: The farmer at Bluegates told us of the nine farms that used to be in Ashwell there are now only four. His land was was once farmed by several farmers.He could remember some of the farms that had gone. They had changed their use. One was Westbury farm also Sam Wallace's Farrows Farm. Where the dentist is now was Kirby's Manor Farm which moved three miles out of the village a hundred years ago. The land is now part of Bluegates Farm and the house is residential. The Angell's farm is still there although there are houses in 'Angell's Meadow'. Then there was a farm where the spraying contractor now is. By the Springs there was Duck Lake Farm. Up to 15 years ago the dairy was in ' Bacon's Yard 'next to the school. It was small and inconvenient. It was smelly and messy so he moved.It's all houses now.
